intro: Otites cuneifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf otites, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central America and the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features finely divided, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a soft, fuzzy texture. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Otites cuneifolius is often grown as an ornamental plant for its delicate appearance and pleasant scent.
